head: NEWBURYPORT REMEMBRANCE TRAIL
body1: The Paris Climate Accord of 2015 was a remarkable achievement but it made clear the limit of greenhouse gas reduction to which nations were committed. The withdrawal of the United States further indicated that there would be limits to commitment itself. In contrast, however, there was from the beginning, robust attention to climate change at the local level. Even before Paris, the City of Newburyport had begun developing plans to mitigate and adapt to the effects of climate change.
body2: It had become clear that if nations simply achieved the Paris goals this risked being too little too late. With uncertainty of international intervention, and understanding that all climate change effects would be local, the city projected the effects into the future and
body2a: Because public demand for energy and other carbon-producing processes ultimately drove GHG emissions, the city hoped to engage the public in a bottom-up action to reduce demand more quickly. Significantly reducing emissions and the effects of climate change would depend on the participation of all residents. The Newburyport Remembrance Trail traces significant milestones in climate change and the fight against its effects on the community.
body3: The Newburyport Remembrance Trail is a public art installation that connects viewers to the challenges communities face from climate change and the ongoing local efforts to address them.
